fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users without Advanced Roadmaps Users permission can attempt to create plan from View all plans page but it failed without an error message.

The respective users can't see the *Create plan* option from the Plans drop down at the top bar, yet, if they go to the *View all plans* page, they can see the *Create plan* button. Once they hit the button, they are prompted with the plan creation form and once they click on the actual create action button, it simply goes out out of the form, the plan isn't created and no message is displayed in the UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Find a user without *Advanced Roadmaps Users* permission
 # Impersonate the user
 # Click on *Plans* at the top bar
 # Click on *Create plan*
 # Fill in the form
 # Notice the plan isn't created and no message is displayed to the user

h3. Expected Results
Users without the permission should not even be able to see the create button.

h3. Actual Results
Users without the permission can follow the plan creation flow and are tricked into thinking their plan was created.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users without Advanced Roadmaps Users permission can attempt to create plan from View all plans page but it failed without an error message

fields.description:
The customers want to have an option to disable the "Product Pages" feature in all of their software projects globally.

Currently, whenever new software projects are created "Product Pages" feature will enable by default and require extra steps to disable it by going into "Project settings > features".
h3. Workaround

This "Product Page" feature can disable from "Project settings > Features".
fields.summary: Ability to disable "Product Pages" feature globally

fields.description:
h4. Summary
As per the current design in Jira, if a user does not have "Schedule issues" permission, then the user will not be able to set the "Due date" field in the Jira issue view and also in the simple roadmaps page.

+_New issue view:_+
The "Due Date" field is uneditable 

+Simple Roadmap:_+
If the user tries to set the start date and due date from the simple roadmap page, then the due date field is not set and the user sees a "Something's gone wrong" error in the UI.

h4. Suggestion
* In the Simple Roadmap page, it would be convenient if we could display a message in the UI that the due date field cannot be set as the user lacks "Schedule Issues" permission. 

* In the Jira new issue view, the due date field can have an information pop-up above the due date field when the user tries to modify the field.
fields.summary: UI Improvement: Improve error messaging in the UI when user tries to set due date in the Simple roadmap page without schedule issues permission

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

As an admin, I would like to have the possibility to send build information from AWS Pipelines to Jira.

This should also include the ability to use Automation for Jira DevOps triggers.
fields.summary: Support Build Integration between Jira Cloud and AWS Pipelines

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After disabling warnings in a plan, Roadmap still shows the warnings in a plan when a user refreshes a plan.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test Roadmap plan.
# Create some issues in the plan.
# Configure the issues in the plan with either "Target date" beyond "Due date" or set the "Target End Date" to an earlier date than the current date. 
# Enable the warnings in the plan and this should allow the plan to display yellow exclamation marks beside the affected issues.
# Turn off the warnings in the plan.
# Refresh the plan.

*  [^PSSRV-26930.webm] 

h3. Expected Results

Roadmap does not display the warnings since it's disabled.

h3. Actual Results

Roadmap still displays the warnings even after it's disabled.

h3. Workaround

None. Users need to toggle the warning again to remove the warnings from the plan.
fields.summary: Roadmap does not remove warning after warnings are disabled

fields.description: I would like for hyperlinks included in descriptions to open up in a new tab. It's a minor suggestion and improvement but it would help with workflows as I know many people would like to keep their issue open and go to the url link.
fields.summary: Allow for hyperlinks/urls to open in a new tab rather than replacing active/current one

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Navigating to the Kanban board and moving one or several issues on it causes the board to become unresponsive and freeze, sometimes it will trigger a timeout error.
During the move, the CPU usage for Chrome will spike to 100%.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigating to a Kanban board.
 # Select one of the multiple issues and move them at a rapid pace across the board.

A Video recording of the issue is attached.
 [^Screen Recording 2021-12-15 at 11.44.01.mov] 

h3. Expected Results
The issue cards should move on the screen flawlessly.
h3. Actual Results
The issue cards get stuck on the screen for a period of time and become unresponsive.
This can cause a timeout error to occur.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Moving one or several issues on a Kanban board causes it to freeze and become unresponsive

fields.description:
The “Dev Summary Panel” in Jira provides a “create branch” link. Clicking on the link currently opens a modal to choose between one of the installed “Code” providers. But GitHub is not available in the list. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

*Suggestion:* 
Need create Branch feature for GitHub
fields.summary: Create Branch feature for GitHub

fields.description: As a JIRA Admin, I want to be able to use some custom status field as a base for columns separation. The system status field is used for all development tickets (Open, In Progress, In QA, Complete, etc).
fields.summary: Ability to map custom field to columns on the board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Team managed project fields are displayed in Scheduling configuration of Plans even when the issue source doesn't include issues from team-managed projects. The simple fact of existing a date field in a team-managed project, it populates the dropdown for *Start Date* and *End Date* of the plan scheduling configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan
 # Set its issue source to company managed projects
 # Create a team managed project
 # Add a new date field to the team managed project
 # Access the plan
 # Head to the plan scheduling configuration
 # Expand the dropdown for the Start or End date to see the field with an ID next to it, which indicates it's a team managed project field.

h3. Expected Results
Plan shouldn't display team managed project fields as it doesn't support team-managed projects.

h3. Actual Results
Plan displays team-managed projects greyed out as they can't be used, indicating an error message as "Make sure to add this field to all the issues sources of this plan".

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team managed project fields are displayed in Scheduling configuration of Plans

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Horizontal Scroll is available when using Advanced Roadmaps' default ranges (weeks, months, quarters, years)

Whereas in Custom Range the horizontal scroll is gone and the full selected range is presented.

It would be nice to have horizontal scrolling available when using a custom date range.
fields.summary: Have horizontal scrolling available when using a custom date range in Advanced Roadmaps Plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the backlog view, elements(issues) listed at the top of the list are shifting up a few pixels when moving the cursor between issues and the quick filters buttons. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the backlog view from a Jira Software(Company-manage) project;
 # Move the cursor between issues and the quick filters buttons;
 # Checking the Developer Tools the issue seems when the cursor is moving up(towards the quick filters) leaving the component below. The container div for the backlog issues (which has the id of ghx-backlog) gets a class of "will-change" added to it upon mouseover.

!Screen Shot 2021-12-13 at 11.08.52 am.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

We should not have any moving issues when moving the cursor between issues and the quick filters buttons.
h3. Actual Results
 # We can see the issues at the top shifting up a few pixels;
 # [^issues in backlog.mp4]

h3. Workaround

At this point, I don't see any workaround as this seems a front-end issue.
fields.summary: Moving the cursor between issues and the quick filters buttons in the backlog is shifting issues up/down a few pixels

fields.description:
When the Epic sidebar is collapsed, it is impossible to tell if you have an active filter by Epic toggled on. This can be particularly confusing when filtering with Quick filters or assignee, you can't tell at a glance if you're getting accurate results.

A simple highlighting of the word "EPIC" on the side would suffice.
fields.summary: Visual indication of filtering by Epic in backlog view

fields.description:
{*}Feature{*}: Support the tenet of Extreme Programming - Pairing

As a product owner

I want a ticket to allow assignment to multiple team members

So that the team is able to asynchronously communicate that they are pairing and mobbing on a ticket
fields.summary: Support for 'Pairing' and 'Mobbing' in ticket assignment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As an admin, would like the ability to add a hyperlink to an external resource in the header of a Project's board. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create board
 # Add hyperlink in header to board

!Board Update.png|width=488,height=76!
fields.summary: Ability to add hyperlink to Project Board

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Advanced Roadmaps uses Issue ranking the order issues in the scope view of the Plan and doesn't allow for custom sorting options outside of rank which can only be managed by dragging and dropping issues.

h3. Proposed solution

Provide a custom sorting option that can include calculations or JQL.
fields.summary: Customized sorting in scope view

fields.description:
Currently, Advanced Roadmaps users in Jira Software Cloud do not have the ability to change the order of columns that are exported as CSV. 

The exported CSV has a fixed order of the sort: Hierarchy, Title, Project, Release...

Giving them option to prioritize column order and also selecting/excluding them would benefit them.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps Plan export should have the option to order Columns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Board settings active quick filter is not being applied after navigation to active sprint then back to Backlog.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a quick filter in the board settings
 # Apply the quick filter - the issues update correctly
 # Navigate to the Active sprint
 # Navigate back to the Backlog - notice the filter is still highlighted but it's not filtering results, and that the 'Clear all' link is visible indicating the filter should be active.

h3. Expected Results
The board settings quick filter should be applied according to the active (highlighted filters) _OR_ on navigating back to the backlog the filters should be cleared (this happens when navigating to the roadmap then back to the backlog)
h3. Actual Results
The board settings quick filter is not applied. (Only issue 1 and issue 3 should be present)
 !4 - Navigate back to backlog filter not applied but UI indicates it shoud be.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Board settings quick filter not filtering after navigation to active sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When landing on the Active Sprint page from the Dashboard that has got Sprint Burndown gadget from the same board, the search bar is not visible on the Active Sprint page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard with Sprint Burndown gadget (note the selected Board)
 # Go to the Admin page of the instance (https://admin.atlassian.com/)
 # From sidebar select Jira
 # From the menu bar select Dashboard
 # Select a Dashboard that has got Sprint Burndown gadget in it
 # While on the Dashboard from the menu bar select Projects
 # Select the project that has got the same Board that is specified in the Sprint Burndown gadget

h3. Expected Results

When land in the Active sprints page to see the search bar
h3. Actual Results

No search bar is available
h3. Workaround

To refresh the page
fields.summary: When landing on the Active Sprint page from the Dashboard that has got Sprint Burndown gadget from the same board, the search bar is not visible on the Active Sprint page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Keyboard shorts related to the issue does not work on Active Sprints, Boards, backlog, and List Views for the following:
 * Assign issue
 * Comment on issue
 * Watch issue
 * Edit issue labels
 * Assign to me

This functionality is available in Jira Server
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Active Sprint board
 # Select an issue
 # keyboard short cut i to Assing to me 

h3. Expected Results

To assign the issue to me
h3. Actual Results

The keyboard shortcut does not do anything
h3. Workaround

To edit the issue and then use the keyboard shortcut
fields.summary: Keyboard shorts related to the issue does not work on Active Sprints, Boards, Backlog and List Views

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a user completes an active sprint, they have an option to send the incomplete issues within that sprint either to the backlog, or into another sprint.

However, if the active sprint is being closed from within a Board that does not have full visibility of *all* of the incomplete issues in the sprint (i.e. if the board uses a more restrictive filter than the [Origin Board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/sprints-appearing-on-multiple-boards-in-jira-server-779159068.html] of the sprint), those not-visible incomplete issues will still be sent to the Backlog, even if the user chooses to send them to another sprint.

This is intentional - issues should not be affected when they aren't present on the Board being worked on. However, we cannot keep them in the active sprint either, since it's being closed. Therefore, they are sent to the backlog. 

However, this is not clarified either in documentation, nor is the user closing the sprint warned of these not-visible issues. 

(!) A consequence of this is that users may later find issues which are not complete, yet belonged to a sprint which has since been completed. It is not easy for users to understand why these issues aren't automatically in an ongoing sprint and are still sitting in the backlog.

h3. Suggested Solution

As this is an intentional, yet not documented or explained to users, we need to:
* Improve the existing documentation at [Completing a sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/completing-a-sprint-938845450.html] 
** [JSWSERVER-20277 : Update Documentation - Clarify that when completing a sprint, sending incomplete issues to the next sprint will still send issues to the backlog if they are not visible from the current board.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-20277]
* Provide additional messaging during the *Complete Sprint* operation. This could include any of the following:
** Explaining how many issues are not visible in scope of the current Board
** A link to the Origin Board of the sprint (so that the user may close the sprint there instead)
** Clarify what will happen to the not-visible issues should the operation complete 

h3. Workaround 

Avoid closing a sprint from a board that isn't the Origin Board of the sprint.

Determine the Origin Board via the *Workaround* steps in [JSWSERVER-13265 : Provide UI method to identify origin board for a sprint.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13265?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Aworklog-tabpanel]
fields.summary: Clarify that when completing a sprint, sending incomplete issues to the next sprint will still send issues to the backlog if they are not visible from the current board.

fields.description:
Currently, GitHub integration performs a text match to map environments from deploys where the text matches are:
* *Developemnt*: development, dev, trunk
* *Testing*: testing, test, tests, tst, integration, integ, intg, int, acceptance, accept, acpt, qa, qc, control, quality
* *Staging*: staging, stage, stg, preprod, model, internal
* *Production*: production, prod, prd, live
* *Unmapped*: no matches

It would be a good idea to have some way to map environments that were not matched and are currently set as unmapped in case the GitHub environment name does no match the predefined texts.
fields.summary: Add ability to map environment type of unmapped GitHub deploys

fields.description:
Hello Team,

I'm able to right-click in an issue of an Active Sprint in a Company-managed project and see the option "Remove from sprint" and sends the issue back to the backlog and on the team-managed projects is not present, can you please add this feature for this kind of projects?
 !image-2021-12-03-13-03-57-072.png|thumbnail! 

Best Regards!
fields.summary: Add "Remove from Sprint" option when right click for team managed projects

fields.description: The customer would like to have the feature to export the roadmap data and import it to a different Jira cloud site.
fields.summary: Ability to export and Import Roadmaps to different Jira sites

fields.description: It would be nice to see if the project is team-managed or company-managed on the project info page. Users cannot create components in team-managed projects, but they can't clearly understand if it is an authorization issue or a project type issue. We can discriminate team-managed projects from the Rest API but seeing this information on the project page will be good.
fields.summary: See if project is team managed or company managed in project details screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem
It looks like the column statuses is not the reflection of the workflow statuses that belongs to the project based on the issue type it has. This creates confusion and customer does not want to depend on the workaround for a long time. 


h3. Environment
JSW boards
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Have workflow schemes shared with different projects
Check one project which has only issue types like story and bug and epic which is associated to this workflow scheme
Now have this workflow scheme associated to another workflow for different issue types like custom ones incident and problem. Have different statuses here check1 and check2
Now you will see that on the Ist project where they do not have the issue types incident and problem, the column status also shows these statuses check1 and check2

h3. Expected Results
The workflow status should reflect only the workflows statuses associated with the project issuetypes

h3. Actual Results
It shows all the statuses which is associated to the workflow schemes

h3. Workaround
 We can use a filter query to take away the statuses or have different workflow schemes for each project. 

h3. Notes
fields.summary: The board columns shows statuses which is not applicable to the project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Accessing the boards following this path *Your work > Boards [tab] > selected Board* takes a long time to load. However when accessing the same board using the *_left panel_* of the Jira project loads as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira software board.
 # Access the newly created board by navigating through *Your work > Boards [tab] > selected Board*.

h3. Expected Results
The load time of the board should be the same as the load time of the board when accessing from the left panel of the Jira project.

h3. Actual Results
The board loads slower when accessed from *Your work > Boards [tab] > selected Board*.

h3. Workaround

 Please access the Jira software boards from the project's left panel.
fields.summary: Accessing the board from Your Work section (top panel) of Jira, the load issue of the board is impacted.

fields.description: A way to configure Roadmaps or Advanced Roadmap Plans to start their week on a day other than Monday (e.g., Sunday). Other items, such as Calendar Pickers, seem to reflect locale and the start of week JQL function seem to start on Sunday but the Roadmaps seem to start on Monday despite any found settings.
fields.summary: Configure the Week Start Day for Roadmaps and Advanced Roadmap Plans

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
On monitors with touchscreen, drag & drop doesn't work as expected to move issues across board columns.

A new page/back button shows up on the screen that blocks the issue transition on project boards.

*Suggested solution*
Provide support for touchscreen behavior on project boards
fields.summary: Provide support for touchscreen behavior on project boards

fields.description:
Hello - 

I just started building out my Jira projects and already noticed that not being able to support cross project releases and components is problematic. This is something that would be absolutely benifical for any business. I did review several forms that explained about other apps that can help with this for additional fees. However, purchasing apps at another cost is not an option for us at this time. This seems like a simple enough suggestion so I thought I'd add it here. The option should be something that the user can toggle on or off or something like that so it's shared only with projects and between projects selected.

 

Thank you

Mia Tayag

mtayag@altiostar.com
fields.summary: Cross Project Release & Component Management

fields.description:
As a Jira administrator, I would like to give visibility on archived version to users which aren't belonging to project's administrator group.
h1. Existing feature

Actually, only project administrators can see archived versions. The «standard» users of the project can see published and unpublished versions only.

As it is +not+ a possibility to give an user the project administrators permission only to allow him the view on archived versions, it would be nice if this behavior could be configurable.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of the needed permissions to see archived versions

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
 * Having Confluence Server instance (with no context path) and Jira Cloud instance
 * Setup Applink
 * Adding Jira Gadget into Confluence
 * Create new page and try to add greenhopper-sprint-health gadget in Macro Browser 

Expected Result
 * Gadget should be displayed or showing login dialog

Actual Result
 * Empty content in Macro Browser Preview

greenhopper-sprint-health contains a script to dynamically load Browser Metric resources (via WRM.require inside gadget iframe). As all static resource are serve by Jira, Browser Metric resources should be served from Jira as well. But actually, Browser Metric resources are serve by Confluence and those resources cause broken gadget functionality. Please see the attachment for more details.
fields.summary: greenhopper-sprint-health Gadget loading wrong Browser Metric resource when intergrate with Confluence Server

fields.description:
Hi, it's common that my teams want to break down Stories into tasks.  The problem is tasks, while they can be linked to Stories, are still treated as a standard issue level object, not child. 

What I would like to see, particularly in the Backlog view is a further nesting of my tasks under a story as opposed to just a property of the task.  For example, the view would have

 

`- My Epic

      + My Story 1

      - My Story 2

           * My Task 1

           * My Task 2

 

This way I can track Story progress based upon the tasks completed visually and organize team work more cleanly.  It's fine to call them Story Tasks to not interfere with existing Tasks but we need a way to break down and visually represent this breakdown more cleanly.
fields.summary: Nested Tasks as children under Stories

fields.description: Currently, only Epics from the same project can be parents of team-managed issues, it would be great if Epics from other projects can be selected as parents of team-managed issues.
fields.summary: Add the option to select team-managed epics from other projects as parent of team-managed issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a team-managed project, after making some Workflow changes, the *Columns and statuses* will remain in a frozen state and won't be able to *Save changes*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a team-managed project and open the *Project settings* → *Issue types* and *Edit workflow* for one of your issue types (tested with a Sub-task)
# Make some changes then *Update workflow* making sure your associate this workflow with a single issue type (the one selected prior)

h3. Expected Results

You should then be redirected to the *Columns and statuses* setting where you will map the statuses to their appropriate columns.

h3. Actual Results

You are redirected to the *Columns and statuses* settings and the page endlessly tries to save the changes made.

 !Settings_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

First, you will see the following message:
{panel}
h4. Workflow updated
It might take a moment for your recent changes to show.
{panel}

After waiting a couple of minutes, you are then presented with the following message:
{panel}
h4. We're still updating your workflow
This update is taking longer than expected and we haven’t saved your changes yet. You can refresh the page to try again.
{panel}

h3. Workaround

You can fix this by making another Workflow change and saving it, this will have a domino effect and fix the problem.
fields.summary: Columns and statuses loads endless after workflow update

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira issues assigned to inactive/disabled users are not included in the plan right now.

There are some specific scenarios such as: the Jira issue is *Done* and assigned to an user that was deactivated/disabled after finishing the issue.
The admins need to show these done issues in the plan, but since they are assigned to an inactive user, they are not included there.
The only way to show them is removing the user as assignee, but this also remove the ability for the admin to see/search for the assignee and assigned issues by the user.
This way, it would be nice if admins have the option to show issues assigned to inactive users in their plan, maybe having this new setting added as option.
fields.summary: Issues assigned to inactive users are not included in the Plan

fields.description:
Having a feature where we can extract user details would be like. At many instances certains user data needs to be extracted like ;
 * how many user logged in Jira after accepting invite
 * how many users log in to Jira everyday 

There may be many other use cases as well.
fields.summary: Users Details Reports for Audit purposes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On scrum boards with card layout displaying the *Development* field, the pull request and build status does not refresh automatically

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a scrum board and add *Development* field in Board settings > Card layout > Active sprints > Add *Development* field
* In an issue, under *Development* click *Create branch* and create a branch, pull request in Bitbucket
* Associate a Bitbucket pipeline with the above branch created and deploy 
* In the issue view, you could see the pull request status and build status (incomplete, complete)
* Check the issue on the active sprint board

h3. Expected Results
The pull request and build status should be updated automatically on the board view

h3. Actual Results
On the scrum board, pull request and build status does not update automatically

h3. Workaround
Edit or transition the issue to display the updated statuses of the *Development* field

Notes: On the board view, the build, pull request status is shown with HTML tags
 !Screenshot 2021-12-01 at 15.38.07.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Build status does not refresh automatically on scrum board view

fields.description: Our organization continues to grow very fast and it is drastically increasing the number of projects that need to be created.  We are attempting to do an Advanced Roadmap for the entire organization but there are too many projects to view them all in the Advanced Roadmap (more than 100).
fields.summary: More than 100 projects in Advanced Roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For team-managed projects, "See all done issues" link is not visible on Done column when there are no issues on the board.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a team-managed software project board
 # Create some issues
 # Check the Done column. It should show a link to "See all done issues"
 # Remove all issues from the board (moving to Done and waiting or simply deleting)

h3. Expected Results

The link for "See all done issues" should be visible on the Done column.
h3. Actual Results

The link for "See all done issues" on the Done column is not visible anymore.
h3. Workaround

Go to the *Project Settings* > *Features* > Enable the *Issue Navigator* feature, so Done issues are visible when accessing the Issues tab on the left sidebar.
fields.summary: "See all done issues" link is not visible when there are no issues on the board

fields.description:
When I am working on a Jira Software project, and I assign Field Configuration Schemes, the schemes show me every field available globally rather than just the fields that apply to Jira Software.  This is a nuisance because that means these fields are going to show up as options in issue layouts and other places, and I have to make sure my users somehow know which ones are applicable to Jira Software and which ones aren't. 

I would love for Field Configurations to be enhanced so that a part of their attributes was a "Product" designation.  That way I could set a field for Jira Service Management and have it ONLY show up there if I wanted, and avoid seeing it in Jira Software (for example).  If there are cases where a single field needs to span multiple products, then I would want to either have that option on the single field I made, or else the ability to make a new field of the same name, but with the other product type assigned.
fields.summary: Allow "field configurations" to correspond with product

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clearing the date input fields in Roadmap export dialog causes an error flag.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Roadmap page.
 # Open the export dialog by clicking on "Export".
 # Clear the start date or due date input fields.

h3. Expected Results

The input fields are empty.
h3. Actual Results

The dialog closes and error flag appears.
h3. Workaround

You can still change to another date.
fields.summary: Clearing the date input fields in Roadmap export dialog causes an error flag

fields.description: When switching to the Week overview (bottom right) it would be useful to add week numbers in the timeline.
fields.summary: Ability to show week numbers in the plan overview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When multiple Sprints are active or closed in a Project, usually the end of the Sprint Name is adjusted to show an incrementing Sprint. However, if the length of the Sprint name is nearing the max of 30 characters, the name is truncated in the drop-down box. This makes it difficult to quickly identify which Sprint needs to be chosen for the Report.

Example of Sprint name being truncated:

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/temporaryattachment/67a25fc4ae4eeae0f1b172f824b446263ea9e817/temp12567452274580320644_image-2021-11-24-17-09-35-189.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple Sprints with 30 characters in the Sprint Name
 # Navigate to Reports and choose Sprint Report
 # In the drop-down box, notice that entries longer than 23-25 characters are truncated at the end of the Sprint name

h3. Expected Results

The drop-down box will auto-resize to fit the length of the largest entry, allowing the full Sprint name to appear.
h3. Actual Results

The drop-down box truncates longer entries.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sprint Names are truncated in the Sprint Report drop-down box

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Allow manual editing of Release notes and save the changes
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select any Version on a project and go to "Release notes". Clicking on the Release notes panel will let you Edit it, that is add/ remove text. 
 # Once some text is added manually, Click on "Done"
 # Refresh the page and the text added will be lost and not saved. 

h3. Expected Results

The added text should be saved. 
h3. Actual Results

Refresh the page and the text added will be lost and not saved. 
h3. Workaround


Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Allow manual editing of Release notes and save the changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some users are unable to open the Roadmap view on their team-managed project despite having no issues accessing the other views such as the *Backlog* and *Board*.

This doesn't affect all users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a team-managed project and open the *Roadmap* view 

h3. Expected Results

The view should be opened.

h3. Actual Results

You get redirected to the _View all projects_ page and presented with an error

{panel}
h4. Project not found
You tried to access a project that doesn't exist or that you don't have permission to see.
{panel}

 !jira_bug_when_opening_roadmap.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

In most cases, clearing your browser's cache and cookies fixes the problem.
fields.summary: Roadmap view for team-managed failing to load

fields.description:
The cross-project release page doesn't offer a way to sort the results. 

Actually, the results are displayed alphabetically.

It would be great if we could select a way to sort by release date.
fields.summary: Add the ability to order the cross-project releases by release date

fields.description:
In premium and enterprise editions of Jira Software Cloud, provide a setting that will allow:
 # *only Site Administrators* to create API Keys for the account. 
 # Also, allow the Site Administrator to associate that API Key to self or to any other User. 

Rationale: From our SSO strategy, we use what we call  Service Accounts in Active Directory, that represent an application.  That application would get an email address like SERV042@<our domain>,  SERV042 would be a  user in Jira assigned to an appropriate group to define its access rights in Jira.  The owners of that application would be provided the API Key and they would incorporate that key into their application
fields.summary: The ability to prevent Basic Users from creating API Keys

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user tries to group by priority in a plan, but the `colourPriorities` field is missing from current saved view, the plan crashes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Open a plan with the `colourPriorities` field missing from current saved view. Not sure why the `colourPriorities` is missing for some users / plans at the moment.
 # Step 2 Open view settings and colour by priority

h3. Expected Results
Schedule bars are coloured according to issue priorities. 

h3. Actual Results
The plan crashes. 


h3. Workaround
Turn off the flag `com.atlassian.rm.jpo.jpo3cloud.addIssueTypeAndPriorityColours`.
fields.summary: Plan crashes when colouring by priority

fields.description:
Sometimes it is needed that some fields appear depending on other field selection, something like the cascade field but with comments, for example. 

It would be useful to have the option to add a condition in the creation screen that shows fields depending on the selection of another field.
fields.summary: Add support to conditions with fields based on other fields in the issue creation process

fields.description:
Enable a way to provide more context to a sprint so that when a user reviews the velocity chart they can see some explanation as to why the team did not meet or massively exceeded their story points. 

 

Potentially on completion of a sprint there is an option to add some notes and these notes are visible under the velocity chart on the table which shows sprint, commitment and completed. Currently I manually record outside of Jira instances outside of our control which impacted our sprint i.e. several members of our squad were off with Covid after planning had been completed.
fields.summary: Enable users to add sprint notes

fields.description: Add support to AppVeyor CI/CD
fields.summary: Add support to AppVeyor for CI/CD
Get all sprints using GET /rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/sprint returns pagination that does not conform to it's own documentation

fields.description:
Currently, empty epics do not appear in the backlog. This is against the typical workflow where an empty epic is created first and stories are added inside the epic.

Suggestion is to stop treating empty epics as entities that do not exist in backlog and sprint boards.
fields.summary: Show empty epics in backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A multi-project (team managed and company managed) rule with *Transition the issue - Copy from trigger issue* action fails as the status IDs are different for company and team managed projects
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a company managed project with workflow statuses To Do, In Progress, and Done
 # Create a team-managed project with the same statuses To Do, In Progress, and Done
 # Create an automation rule as below to copy the issue status from the trigger issue
!Workflow.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create an issue in both company-managed and team-managed projects OR an issue each in two team-managed projects
 # In the team-managed project issue, link the issue created in the company-managed project
#  Change the status of the issue in the team-managed project

h3. Expected Results

The linked issue from the company-managed project should transition to the same status the team-managed project issue is in
h3. Actual Results

The rule fails with an error message that destination status could not be resolved
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Transition issue action fails for multi project automation rule

fields.description:
In Company Managed projects, customers using Quick filters are currently unable to view it in the "old view" that shows up as tabs but see all the options configured as drop-down options when the number of Quick filters exceeds 31.

They would benefit from the implementation of a *Select-All* option for them to view everything at once instead of them clicking each option through the drop-down.
fields.summary: Implement Quick filters Select-All feature

fields.description: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, one needs the ability to manually sort releases/fix versions without using rank.
fields.summary: Add the ability to manually rank Releases/Fix versions

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have the ability to change the release icons in advanced roadmaps.

Actually, all releases show the same icon.

 

!image-2021-11-18-16-10-04-627.png|width=379,height=330!
fields.summary: Add the ability to change release icons in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Problem
when the *Subtask* type is changed to a different name, for ex: "Child", the board does not work well with group by ( child) with filter epic. It displays issues only without the subtasks and does not show issues with subtasks( child in this case).

h3. Environment

Team managed project

.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Access a team managed project.
* Create epics with stories( having subtasks and no subtasks)
* Access the board
* Use group by ( Subtask) and filter by epic. 
* Note the layout on the board which shows (Displays issues without the subtasks and displays issues with subtasks in a separate view)
* Now change the issuetype name ( Subtask to Child)
* Access the board
* Note the layout on the board which displays issues without the subtasks only.
h3. Expected Results
It should show issues( stories) with subtask and issues without subtask when using the group by for ( Child - renamed issuetpe for subtask) and using the filter epic.
h3. Actual Results
Only issues without subtask is being displayed

h3. Workaround
 Use the same name as *Subtask*  for issue type
h3. Notes
fields.summary: When changing the name of the Subtask issuetype and using the Group by subtask, the epic filter does not work correctly

fields.description: Please add the availability to include the Forms available on JWM to Team-managed Software Projects
fields.summary: Include Forms in Team-managed Software Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Allow Creation of Epic under Initiative or their hierarchal parent from the issue-view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any issue from the top hierarchy which just above the epic.
 # Try creating an inline issue and it would only give the option for standard issue types like story, task etc.

h3. Expected Results

We would like to be able to have the option to inline create an epic directly under hierarchal parent rather than linking it separately.
h3. Actual Results

Currently, the inline create issue only gives the option for standard issue types like story, task etc but not an epic.
h3. Workaround
 # We could create the epic separately and add the parent link as the hierarchal parent.
 # You could try creating the epic directly under the parent from the advanced roadmaps plan view.
fields.summary: Allow Creation of Epic under Initiative or their hierarchal parent from the issue-view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In company-managed board, parallel sprints are allowed even the feature is turned off

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable 'Parallel sprints for company-managed projects' in settings > products
# Start parallel sprints in a project
# Disable 'Parallel sprints for company-managed projects' in settings > products
# Go back to the project board to check if the parallel sprints are still active

h3. Expected Results
* Parallel sprints should no longer be active

h3. Actual Results
* Parallel sprints remain active

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: In a company-managed board, parallel sprints are allowed even the feature is turned off

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Company Managed Kanban board pulling issues from a Team Managed Scrum projects. 

The problem is that Subtasks should be grouped with the parent (in terms of ranking on a board). However, it's been possible to un-group them, and when the subtasks gets to the top or bottom of the list, you are unable to change the rank of the subtasks. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Company Managed Kanban Board
 # Create 3 issues in this project
 # Create a Team Managed Scrum Board
 # Create 3 issues in this project + 1 Epic + a few subtasks
 # In the Company Managed Kanban board, change the board filter to something similar.
{code:java}
 project in ("Project1", "Project2") ORDER BY Rank ASC {code}

 # Map the Status to Columns in the Kanban Board
 # Drag all the Team Managed issues into the In Progress column, making sure the subtask is not at the bottom of the column
 # Open a new tab and create a new subtasks under the Epic (from step 4)
 # Drag the new subtask on the Kanban board to the In Progress column

h3. Expected Results

The new subtask created in step 8 should be grouped with the parent and should be able to be re-ranked.
h3. Actual Results

The new subtask is at the bottom of the column and can't be re-ranked.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When using a Company Managed Kanban board to display Team Managed Scrum issues may result in ranking issues

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to have a Multi Select Custom Field like 'Components' and 'Versions' system fields as shown in the screenshot below-

!image-2021-11-17-22-17-08-913.png|width=334,height=201!

Having a template like the one used by the '{*}Components{*}' and '{*}Versions{*}' system fields is requested.
fields.summary: Multi Select Custom Field like 'Components' and 'Versions' system fields

fields.description: My teams reached out to me with the following request: they need to change issue colors in the Roadmaps feature, e.g. based on JQL as it can be done with Card Colors in Board Settings.
fields.summary: Allow changing colors for issues in Roadmap

fields.description: I would like to be able to add CC emails to a specific custom field, this is helpful when more than one assignee is required.
fields.summary: Mail handler - Be able to add CC's to custom field.

fields.description:
it would be a good user experience if you remove the closed sprints from the "Recent Sprint " section as it is confusing the user 

 

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/135656i83F6A53307DC1EF4/image-size/large?v=v2&px=999!
fields.summary: Remove recent closed sprints
JQL for historical flagged issues

fields.description:
We would like to see the Cascading Select field added as a supported option from the add Custom Field screen within the Advanced Roadmaps plan.

!image-2020-09-20-10-22-13-147.png|width=458,height=130!
fields.summary: Add Cascading Select field as an available custom field option

fields.description:
Currently, there is no way to configure transition screens in workflow in team-managed projects.
It would be nice if we could display a transition screen in team-manage projects as well as we can in company-managed projects.
fields.summary: Ability to display a transition screen  in team-managed project

fields.description: The ability to assign a Status to more than one column on the board. This would enable 1 admin-created workflow to support all boards that teams would imagine.  Backlog, to-do, in-progress, done, could then be formulated into any board structure a team would want.  If we did want greater enterprise visibility into the team (for example ‘Testing’) we would add this to one WF and make it available to all projects.
fields.summary: Assign same Status to multiple columns on the board

fields.description: The ability to turn-off Invite Others – As an Enterprise Jira License, and using our Okta SSO and a locked Jira User Group, within Jira, the Invite option set-ups an incorrect user structure  (wrong Jira Group, no SSO configured).  So, it is basically useless.  However, it’s there and people click it…  I’d like to turn it off…
fields.summary: Turn of invite others for enterprise account

fields.description: The ability to Create a Matching Board when copy-from Project – Use the defined workflow on the copy-from project to create a board for the new project that matches the structure of the workflow. Appears I have to create a board the new project for a copy-from project.
fields.summary: Create matching board when copy-from project

fields.description: The ability to define one or more Common Sprint Calendars – The ability to define one or more Sprint Calendars that Company-Managed projects can be assigned to.  This would include the Sprint identifier (a String) and a start and end date. Maybe a RegEx for the format of the sprint name.
fields.summary: Common Sprint Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding a new field and repointing Flagging functionality to capture the 'Flagged Reason" in this new field such that the recent Flagged reason is always displayed in the issue field.
h3. Suggestion
 # Ability to Capture the latest 'Flagged Reason' in the Issue field "Flagged Reason"
 # Ability to automatically clear 'Flagged reason' when the issue is unflagged.
 # Ability to filter and report on 'Flagged reason'.
 # Make 'Flagged reason' more visible in issue context/description layout, instead of being buried in comments.
fields.summary: Provide a new field for the Issue Flagging Functionality to capture the recent 'Flagged Reason' for the issue

fields.description: Currently, it is possible to add team-managed issues in a company-managed board filter but the team-managed issues lost some features like for example, showing subtasks in swimlanes by story mode or Epics functionalities.
fields.summary: Add full support to issues from team-managed projects in company-managed boards

fields.description: Add the group by feature available in team-managed board view into company-managed boards, company-managed have swimlanes that work in a similar way but the user needs to access the board settings every time he wants to change it and affects the view to all users, group by option in team-managed is available for every user and it only affects his view.
fields.summary: Add the group by feature available in team-managed boards into company-managed boards

fields.description: We want the the ability to hide statuses from next gen boards.  Such as *cancelled* status, that is used but not so it takes up real estate on the screen as a column (too many columns means a scroll bar in jira next-gen boards > not great for standups / quick reviews > not a great UX). it does not a column.
fields.summary: Ability to Hide Statuses from Jira Boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Provide the ability to make the Flagged Reason/Comment field to be a Required field when Adding or Removing the flag from the *issue cards* on the Board or From the {*}Issue Details View{*}.
h3. Suggestion:
 # As of the current design when adding a Flag or Removing a Flag from an Issue Card on a scrum or kanban *board* (Right Click on the *Issue* Card > {*}Add{*}/{*}Remove{*} Flag) a Pop-up window appears with a Comment field in it. However, the same feature is not available when adding or removing a flag from the *Issue View.* This feature is requested in the following article: JSWCLOUD-17127 *Add the 'Add flag and comment' and 'Remove flag and add comment' to the issue view screen menus*
 ** A further recommendation would be to provide the ability to the JIRA Admins to make the comment field *Required* or *Optional* for this operation. Currently, the comment is always an optional field. If the field is set to *required* this will make sure the "Flagged Reason" is captured from the user every time an issue is flagged.
 # Only when the user adds a comment in the comment field during Add/Remove flag operation, only then we get a    !https://jira.atlassian.com/images/icons/emoticons/flag.png|width=16,height=16!   icon or    !https://jira.atlassian.com/images/icons/emoticons/flag_grey.png|width=16,height=16!   icon in the comment section. Hence, making comment a required field will make sure a consistent flagged history is maintained.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to make the Flagged Reason/Comment field to be a Required field when Adding or Removing the flag from the issue cards on the Board or From the Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to link organization using "GitHub for Jira" Add-on when [GitHub IP Allowlist|https://docs.github.com/en/organizations/keeping-your-organization-secure/managing-allowed-ip-addresses-for-your-organization] is enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable [GitHub IP Allowlist|https://docs.github.com/en/organizations/keeping-your-organization-secure/managing-allowed-ip-addresses-for-your-organization] on GitHub Organization
 # Try to Connect GitHub organization
!image-2021-11-09-15-37-25-010.png|width=400! 
!image-2021-11-09-15-38-04-782.png|width=400!

h3. Expected Results

It is expected that integration succeeds.
h3. Actual Results
GitHub page throws error "Looks like something went wrong!"
!image-2021-11-09-15-40-45-313.png|width=400!

h3. Workaround
Disabling [GitHub IP Allowlist|https://docs.github.com/en/organizations/keeping-your-organization-secure/managing-allowed-ip-addresses-for-your-organization] entirely.
fields.summary: Unable to link organization using "GitHub for Jira" Add-on when GitHub IP Allowlist is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing a board from a company-managed project and refreshing the page, the focus go to search box and disable shortcuts.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any JSW project and go to board - Active Sprints or Backlog
 # You can see that it's possible to use shortcuts as "." 
 # Refresh the page
 # The focus go to search box and if you try to use "." shortcut, this does not work

h3. Expected Results

The search should not go to search box, the same way it happens when you access the board for the first time.
h3. Actual Results

The focus go to search and this disable shortcuts. You need to click out of the input to make it work again.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When accessing a board and refreshing the page, the focus go to search and disable shortcuts

fields.description:
In simple roadmaps from company-managed boards, it is possible to display a timeline bar for tasks when they belong to a Sprint with start and end dates but cross-board Sprints are not supported so if the Sprint was created in a different board the bar will not be displayed.

Use the next REST API call to get the origin board.
https://<site>.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/<sprintId>
fields.summary: In simple roadmaps for company-managed, add support to view Cross-board Sprints

fields.description:
When using the Jira Calendar gadget to track issues on dashboards, there are no options to easily distinguish between issues assignees.

As a Jira Admin, it would be great to have the ability to select different colors for different assignees or have it automatically set in a spectrum of colors, to easily differentiate issues' assignees at a glance.
fields.summary: Add color customization options for Jira Calendar dashboard gadget

fields.description:
On the project features page you cannot turn off components.  Where we use Jira for non product departments, components has little value and is often a bit confusing for some of the people using it. We would like to be able to disable components and remove it from the menu bar for individual projects

Also - Please add a component in your own project for Project - Settings - Components which would make it easier to assign the correct component from your list of components
fields.summary: Hide components from menubar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a user, I want to be able to share a project's roadmap/project without consuming licenses.
h3. Suggested Solution

A user should be able to share a link to somebody else that provides view access to the project without having to explicitly consume a license of its instance

Also, allow users to embed the Roadmap view in external pages/websites
h3. Workaround

Customers can already export a roadmap to an image and thus share a non-interactive version of the roadmap with stakeholders. The image export is available in the roadmap's _Export_ button.
fields.summary: Ability share Roadmaps/projects without consuming a license

fields.description:
h3. Problem
 We would like to hide issue types on our projects from the create issue screen without having to migrate the existing issues by removing the issuetype from the scheme

h3. Suggested Solution
_(Add a suggested solution once one has been determined)_

h3. Why This Is Important
Likes to restrict this to the users on the create screen

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Hide issuetypes from create screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem

As of now we can only copy the entire rule and not the steps. It would be great to have an option to copy and move the steps in the rule. This feature will help to duplicate the steps. Maybe just underneath the original step, and then able to use the UI to drag the step into where we need it.
h3. Suggested Solution
_(Add a suggested solution once one has been determined)_

h3. Why This Is Important
It gives the customers flexibility and easy configuration of the Automation.

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Ability to copy/duplicate automation steps inside a rule

fields.description:
In example, I have a userstory. The userstory has 6 subtasks. Two of them are related to a design, two to implementation and two for testing.

Would be really a great feature if it would be possible to either configure in settings how the subtask present under a main task (story). Either apply grouping based on rules or upon creating subtask, define if the subtask has a "section" it belongs to.

Final result would look something like:

---------------

Story: As a customer I want ice cream every friday (main task)

= Before (section)
 * Make sure I have enough money (subtask)
 * Walk to ice cream shop

= During
 * Eat ice cream
 * Throw away trash

= After
 * Go home
 * Be happy

---------------

This kinda organizing would help many different customers cases
fields.summary: Add possibility to group subtasks

fields.description:
Bitbucket repository avatars are not rendered on the development panel in Chrome browser both in the old and new issue view, but it works fine in Mozilla Firefox.

*Actual:*

 !Actual.png|thumbnail! 


*Expected:*

 !Expected.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bitbucket repository avatars are not retrieved on the development panel in JIRA issues in Chrome browser

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Duplicate issues still appear in Jira
h3. Suggested Solution

Duplicate issues to be closed/resolved automatically in Jira
h3. Why This Is Important

Currently, Issues marked as Duplicate used to be still visible in Jira which creates confusion so if it is closed/resolved automatically while the other one remains alive for the workflow.
h3. Workaround

_The duplicate issue can be closed using automation rules. Please refer to this [community article |https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management/How-Delete-Issue-with-the-same-name/qaq-p/1494037]for more details._
fields.summary: Duplicated issues to be resolved/closed automatically in Jira and set duplicate resolution to it.

fields.description: In our team we need to have each task's status time tracking; for example, we need to know how many hours "task A-1" were in "to be started" status, "in progress" status or in any other statuses that we are tracking in our team; this feature will help us to track our team members' performance during each month.
fields.summary: Adding a feature to have time tracking of each task in each status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Incorrect Behaviour in chart generation when Sprint Start date is non-working day
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start a Sprint on a non-working day.
 # Open Burndown chart report.
 # Toggle between "Non-workingdays" and "working days" on chart and we can see inconsistent data in chart.

h3. Expected Results

The Burndown chart should show the exact sprint details regardless of the button "non-working days" being toggled on and off.
h3. Actual Results

The graph of the sprint changes when the "non-working days" is toggled on and off.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Incorrect Behaviour in chart generation when Sprint Start date is non-working day

fields.description:
Hi team, 

Need your suggestion, how to setup future sprint can show up on Roadmap? Currently only Active Sprint show up on Roadmap timeline. 

Thanks

 

!image-2021-11-07-20-48-48-711.png|width=460,height=171!
fields.summary: Future Sprint not visible on roadmap

fields.description:
Creating a project will have some features enabled by default: releases for example. 
Those can be toggled off on each project.

It would be nice to have a global configuration to disable them by default.
fields.summary: Add the option to select default features for projects globally.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to edit the filter shares in the board's settings using the *Edit Filter Shares* link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the board's settings
 # Click on *Edit Filter Shares* (you will only see this option if you are an owner of that filter)

h3. Expected Results

Edit Current filter window will open.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens like the link is dead. However, if you hover the mouse cursor over the link, you can see the URL in there.
 No visible error either in the UI or in the dev tool.
h3. Workaround

As for an alternative solution,
 # *Right-click* on the link and open it in a new tab.
 # Go to *Filters > View all filters > Search for that filter* and click on the three dots (*...*) to *Edit*.
fields.summary: "Edit Filter Shares" link in the Board settings is broken (company-managed)

fields.description: Ability to Advanced Roadmaps show the capacity of a single user that belongs to a team.
fields.summary: Ability to Advanced Roadmaps show the capacity of a single user that belongs to a team

fields.description:
h4. Problem definition:
Sending Twilio notifications via. Automation only allows a valid phone number to be added to the 'From' field.

h4. Suggested Solution:
Allow using smart-values to the 'From' field.

h4. Why is this important:
Allow sending prefix <whatsapp:> before the number so Twilio knows to send a WhatsApp message instead of SMS.

Workaround:
No workaround is available.

!Screen Shot 2021-11-08 at 12.30.02.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Change the Automation field 'From' to allow smart-values for the 'Send Twilio notification' rule.

fields.description:
Currently, the roadmap doesn't display a progress bar as it does for Epics.
The progress bar is based on the Start Date and Due Date fields, which are also used by the other standard issue types. It would be nice to have a progress bar in roadmap for standard issue types (Task, Story, Bug) too.
fields.summary: Display progress bar in roadmap for standard issue types just like it does for Epics

fields.description: It isn't possible to change the environment types under Deployments > View settings right now so users are only able to select/deselect the standard environment types but cannot edit or add additional ones in.
fields.summary: Provide ability to customise environment types in deployments settings

fields.description: Had a issue in getting the story points of sprint
fields.summary: Had a issue in getting the storypoints of sprint
